meanings.definition: A person or thing that emits something, such as light or sound.
meanings.sent1: The emitters of the music were the talented musicians on stage.
meanings.sent2: The fire alarm had multiple emitters to ensure the sound reached every corner of the building.
meanings.sent3: The noisy parrot was the unexpected emitter of laughter in the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an emitter of joy, lighting up the room with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The emitters of the stars in the night sky fascinated the young astronomer.

meanings.definition: A device that emits radiation or particles.
meanings.sent1: The Geiger counter is an essential emitter in detecting radiation levels.
meanings.sent2: The smoke detector is a safety device that functions as an emitter in case of fire.
meanings.sent3: The little robot vacuum cleaner turned out to be the mischievous emitter of dust bunnies.
meanings.sent4: The sun acted as a powerful emitter of warmth, embracing the Earth in its rays.
meanings.sent5: The emitter in the laboratory was crucial for the experiment to produce accurate results.

meanings.definition: A source or origin of something.
meanings.sent1: The old library was the emitter of many classic literary works.
meanings.sent2: The factory was the main emitter of pollution in the area.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat turned out to be the emitter of chaos in the peaceful household.
meanings.sent4: Her childhood home was the emitter of cherished memories that she held dear.
meanings.sent5: The small bakery was the emitter of delicious aromas that filled the neighborhood.
